An uncharged trident is dropped by the normal cave krakens, while the boss kraken can drop a fully charged trident. The trident of the seas (or uncharged trident when uncharged) is a powered staff requiring 75 Magic to wield. They are obtained as a rare Slayer task drop from cave krakens or krakens with level 87 Slayer. An uncharged trident is dropped by the normal cave krakens, while the boss kraken can drop a fully charged trident. Similarly to Barrows equipment, the trident is only tradeable when either uncharged or fully charged.

The staff has a built-in magic spell that can be used regardless of the spellbook the player is using, although it cannot be used to autocast any other combat spells. The spell gives no base experience and grants the player 2 Magic experience per damage dealt. The casting range of the spell is seven tiles, or nine on longrange. The staff has a cast speed of 4 which is 1 tick faster than casting from the standard spellbook with most other staves excluding the Harmonised nightmare staff.

The spell cannot be used against other players in the Wilderness. The only way that the spell can be used against other players is during the Castle Wars and TzHaar Fight Pit minigames, as well as the Clan Wars minigame if the clan leaders enable it.

The trident of the seas has the same effect in drift net fishing as the Merfolk trident,[1] though it does not have the ability to hold Pufferfish charges (convenient for breathing underwater).

A player using the trident of the sea's built in spell.

Combat styles[edit | edit source]

Charging[edit | edit source]

A player charging the trident of the seas.

In order to use the trident's magic spell, it must be charged with various runes, holding up to 2,500 charges when fully charged. One charge is consumed each time you cast the built-in spell. Charging the trident requires level 75 Magic, and the following items are required for a single charge:

Item Cost per charge
1 x Death rune 186
1 x Chaos rune 69
5 x Fire rune 25
10 x Coins 10
Total cost per charge 290

To charge the trident, use the runes or coins on the trident. Assuming non-stop use (one cast every 2.4 seconds, 1,500 casts per hour), the trident costs 435,000 per hour to use.

Fully charging an uncharged staff costs 725,000 total: 2,500 death runes, 2,500 chaos runes, 12,500 fire runes and 25,000 coins.

Any remaining charges within the trident can be removed at anytime using the 'uncharge' option to recover the runes; however, the coins will not be refunded.

If lost on death, only the uncharged trident will appear on the floor.

Rune substitutes, such as elemental staves or the Fountain of Rune, combination runes, or runes in a rune pouch cannot be used to charge the trident, and yields a special message "You need one death rune, one chaos rune, five fire runes, and ten coins. Rune substitutes and pouches cannot be used".

Maximum hit[edit | edit source]

The maximum hit dealt by the trident is dependent on the player's current Magic level, starting at 20 with level 75 Magic and increasing by one every three Magic levels, up to a maximum of 35 at level 120 (obtainable only through an overload (+) in Chambers of Xeric). Both magic damage bonuses and stat boosts will modify the max hit of the spell; likewise, stat-reductions will lower the damage. The trident always has a max hit of at least 1, even when reduced to 0 magic. Compared to the other two powered staves, the Trident of the swamp increases the base maximum hit by 3 (max of 23 at level 75), and the Sanguinesti staff increases the base maximum hit by 4 (max of 24 at level 75).

Upgrading[edit | edit source]

Players can give an uncharged trident and 10 kraken tentacles to Lieve McCracken to create an enhanced trident of the seas, which holds 20,000 charges instead of 2,500.

Players with level 59 Crafting can attach a magic fang to the trident using a chisel, creating a trident of the swamp. This enhances its magic attack bonus, and has the ability to infect a target with venom. However, to take advantage of those benefits requires using 1 Zulrah's scale instead of 10 coins for each charge. Players can attach a magic fang to an enhanced trident to create an enhanced trident of the swamp.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
15 November 2018
(update)

The item's inventory sprite was adjusted slightly.

11 October 2018
(update)

The item's inventory sprite was rotated.

6 October 2016
(update)

The damage cap of the Tridents has been increased by 1 so it can respect the maximum possible Magic stat-boost from the Imbued Heart.

24 September 2015
(update)

An additional attack style has been added to the trident to prevent it switching your selected attack style for other weapons. This new attack style has no impact on combat stats.

8 January 2015
(update)

The trident of seas can now be upgraded to a trident of the swamp by attaching a magic fang.

14 August 2014
(update)

The trident of the seas no longer damages Salarin the Twisted.

27 February 2014
(update | poll)

The trident of the seas can now cast its spell on players in Castle Wars and the TzHaar Fight Pit.

6 February 2014
(update)

The trident of the seas has had its model adjusted slightly to prevent it sticking to Verac's skirt or the pantaloons.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The trident is a reference to the trident of the Greek god of seas, Poseidon.
  • The trident of the seas is the Old School RuneScape equivalent to the polypore staff from RuneScape.

References[edit | edit source]

They are obtained as a rare [[Slayer task]] drop from [[cave kraken]]s or [[kraken]]s with level 87 [[Slayer]]. An uncharged trident is dropped by the normal cave krakens, while the boss kraken can drop a fully charged trident. Similarly to [[Barrows equipment]], the trident is only tradeable when either uncharged or fully charged. The staff has a built-in magic spell that can be used regardless of the [[spellbook]] the player is using, although it cannot be used to autocast any other combat spells. The spell gives no base experience and grants the player 2 [[Magic]] experience per damage dealt. The casting range of the spell is seven tiles, or nine on longrange. The staff has a cast speed of 4 which is 1 tick faster than casting from the standard spellbook with most other staves excluding the [[Harmonised nightmare staff]]. The spell '''cannot''' be used against other players in the [[Wilderness]]. The only way that the spell can be used against other players is during the [[Castle Wars]] and [[TzHaar Fight Pit]] [[minigame]]s, as well as the [[Clan Wars]] minigame if the clan leaders enable it. The trident of the seas has the same effect in [[drift net fishing]] as the [[Merfolk trident]],{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1148163991405043713|date=8 July 2019|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/save/https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1148163991405043713|archivedate=26 August 2019|quote=[Does the trident of the seas have the same effect in driftnet fishing as the merfolk trident?] Yes.}} though it does not have the ability to hold [[Pufferfish]] charges (convenient for breathing [[underwater]]). [[File:Trident of the seas spell.gif|thumb|250px|A player using the trident of the sea's built in spell.]] {{Infobox Bonuses |version1 = Uncharged |version2 = Partially charged |version3 = Charged |astab = 0 |aslash = 0 |acrush = 0 |amagic = +15 |arange = 0 |dstab = +2 |dslash = +3 |dcrush = +1 |dmagic = +15 |drange = 0 |str = 0 |rstr = 0 |mdmg = 0 |prayer = 0 |slot = weapon |speed = 4 |attackrange = 7 |combatstyle = Powered Staff |image = [[File:Trident of the seas equipped.png|150px]] |altimage1 = [[File:Uncharged trident equipped female.png|150px]] |altimage2 = [[File:Trident of the seas equipped female.png|150px]] |altimage3 = [[File:Trident of the seas (full) equipped female.png|150px]] }} ==Combat styles== {{CombatStyles|Powered Staff}} ==Charging== [[File:Charging trident.gif|frame|A player charging the trident of the seas.]] In order to use the trident's magic spell, it must be charged with various [[runes]], holding up to 2,500 charges when fully charged. One charge is consumed each time you cast the built-in spell. Charging the trident requires level 75 Magic, and the following items are required for a single charge: {|class="wikitable" !Item !Cost per charge |- |1 x {{plink|Death rune}} |{{Coins|{{GEP|Death rune}}}} |- |1 x {{plink|Chaos rune}} |{{Coins|{{GEP|Chaos rune}}}} |- |5 x {{plink|Fire rune}} |{{Coins|{{GEP|Fire rune|5}}}} |- |10 x {{plink|Coins}} |{{Coins|10}} |- |'''Total cost per charge''' |{{Coins|{{GEP|Death rune}}+{{GEP|Chaos rune}}+{{GEP|Fire rune|5}}+10}} |} To charge the trident, use the runes or coins on the trident. Assuming non-stop use (one cast every 2.4 seconds, 1,500 casts per hour), the trident costs {{Coins|({{GEP|Death rune}}+{{GEP|Chaos rune}}+{{GEP|Fire rune|5}}+10) * 1500}} per hour to use. Fully charging an uncharged staff costs {{Coins|{{GEP|Death rune|2500}}+{{GEP|Chaos rune|2500}}+{{GEP|Fire rune|12500}}+25000}} total: 2,500 death runes, 2,500 chaos runes, 12,500 fire runes and 25,000 coins. Any remaining charges within the trident can be removed at anytime using the 'uncharge' option to recover the [[runes]]; however, the coins will '''not''' be refunded. If lost on [[death]], only the uncharged trident will appear on the floor. Rune substitutes, such as elemental staves or the [[Fountain of Rune]], combination runes, or runes in a [[rune pouch]] '''cannot''' be used to charge the trident, and yields a special message "You need one death rune, one chaos rune, five fire runes, and ten coins. Rune substitutes and pouches cannot be used". ==Maximum hit== The [[Maximum Magic hit|maximum hit]] dealt by the trident is dependent on the player's current [[Magic]] level, starting at 20 with level 75 Magic and increasing by one every three Magic levels, up to a maximum of 35 at level 120 (obtainable only through an [[overload (+)]] in [[Chambers of Xeric]]). Both magic damage bonuses and stat boosts will modify the max hit of the spell; likewise, stat-reductions will lower the damage. The trident always has a max hit of at least 1, even when reduced to 0 magic. Compared to the other two powered staves, the [[Trident of the swamp]] increases the base maximum hit by 3 (max of 23 at level 75), and the [[Sanguinesti staff]] increases the base maximum hit by 4 (max of 24 at level 75). {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; white-space:nowrap;" |- ! rowspan="2" |{{SCP|Magic}}

Players with level 59 [[Crafting]] can attach a [[magic fang]] to the trident using a [[chisel]], creating a [[trident of the swamp]]. This enhances its magic attack bonus, and has the ability to infect a target with [[venom]]. However, to take advantage of those benefits requires using 1 [[Zulrah's scales|Zulrah's scale]] instead of 10 coins for each charge. Players can attach a magic fang to an enhanced trident to create an [[Trident of the swamp (e)|enhanced trident of the swamp]]. ==Products== {{Uses material list|Uncharged trident}} ==Item sources== {{Drop sources|Trident of the seas}} {{Magic weapons comparison}} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 15 November 2018 |update = POH Portals, DHCB Recolour and Planned Changes |change = The item's inventory sprite was adjusted slightly. }} {{Subject changes |date = 11 October 2018 |update = Spellbook Rework, Wise Old Man and, Increased Zoom |change = The item's inventory sprite was rotated. }} {{Subject changes |date = 6 October 2016 |update = The Hill Giant Boss |poll = |change = The damage cap of the Tridents has been increased by 1 so it can respect the maximum possible Magic stat-boost from the Imbued Heart. }} {{Subject changes |date = 24 September 2015 |update = New Animations & Barbarian Assault Changes |change = An additional attack style has been added to the trident to prevent it switching your selected attack style for other weapons. This new attack style has no impact on combat stats. }} {{Subject changes |date = 8 January 2015 |update = Zulrah - The Solo Snake Boss |change = The trident of seas can now be upgraded to a trident present |} ==Trivia== *The trident is a reference to the trident of the Greek god of seas, {{wp|Poseidon}}. *The trident of the seas is the ''[[Old School RuneScape]]'' equivalent to the {{RSL|polypore staff}} from ''{{RSL|RuneScape}}''. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Magic weapons}} {{Kraken Cove}} [[Category:Items subject to Grand Exchange item sink]]
